creator: arnoldguo@21cn.com
text:
My apache can not display page until it can write error info into log,it's very 
stranger,is it normal?For some reson errorlog sometimes will be over 2G bytes
(ext2 filesystem limit,and somestime manyprocesses to write to log file 
simultaneous,and will make apache can not display pages),how can i make apache 
work properly whether apache can write error info?

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
You need to rotate your log. It's considered critical if there's no way to write
out (error/any) messages and therefore Apache won't work properly.
*** Bug 25763 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
